definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: One day their luck runs out.
sentences.chinese: 總有一天，他們的運氣會氣數已盡。

sentences.english: You know, as times gose by, they say, He's washed up.
sentences.chinese: 隨着時間流逝，有人會說，他氣數盡了。

sentences.english: And “outsize fiscal deficits” suggest that fiscal stimulus may also be exhausted.
sentences.chinese: “特大號財政赤字”也暗示財政刺激可能也氣數將近。

sentences.english: And now I live, and now my life is done.
sentences.chinese: 此時我活着，卻氣數已盡。

sentences.english: Various factions of the Cabal are beginning to realize that the end is near.
sentences.chinese: 陰謀集團的諸多派系開始意識到自己的氣數將盡。

definition: to die out/to be exterminated/to become extinct
wine, sex, avarice and temper (idiom); four cardinal vices
the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
